statement.p: Instructions call for producing a solution of ropivacaine hydrochloride that contains 2 g of the provided dry solute with 1 mL of sterile water. What is the

solution.p: We use the definitions for solutions of dry ingredients in a solution.
The dilution ratio is defined to be grams of solute per mL of diluent added. We have 2 g of solute with 1 mL of diluent added, so the ratio is 2/1.

The dilution factor is defined to be grams of solute per mL of solution resulting. We have 2 g of solute in 1 mL of diluent, so the ratio is 2/1. Sometimes it is written as simply 1. Note, this matches dilution ratio because the solute adds almost no volume to the solution (too small to measure).

The percent concentration is defined to be grams of solute per mL of solution resulting written as a percent. We have 2 g of solute in 1 mL of diluent, so the percent is \displaystyle\frac{{2}}{{1}}\cdot{100}={200}\%.
